channel.title: R on worldwideDemographic
channel.description: Recent content in R on worldwideDemographic

item.title: Introduction
item.description: p { text-indent:2em; padding:0px; margin:0px; } At the beginning, an overall scatter plot is adopted to generate the whole situation. Thus, income level appears to be a vital factor to dig deeper. In this way, five representatives within each income level have been chosen to generate the population situation. Despite the income level, life expectancy values a lot in this case. Afterward, someone may consider whether there exist other external factors for this case.

item.title: Decline in fertility rates in 2013 compared with 1960
Worldwide Fertility Rate at year of 2013
item.description: Worldwide Fertility Rate at year of 2013 To describe the changes in fertility rates in countries around the world in 2013, I make a choropleth map whcih shading geographic regions by item.title: Countrys with the longest life expectancy over times
item.description: Countrys with the longest life expectancy over times. Countrys with the longest life expectancy over times in the peroid of 1960~2013.

item.title: Demographic trends of five representative countries considering IncomeLevel
Animation scatter of fertility rate vs life expectancy
item.description: Animation scatter of fertility rate vs life expectancy A scatter plot of life expectancy and fertility rate , each dot in the plot represent one country and the size of the dot indicates the number of population and the color of the dot represents the region of each coutry. clicking the play button at the bottom of the graph, the scatter animated with the year.
